intro: Octotheca, commonly known as the "hedgehog plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky bracts that resemble the spines of a hedgehog, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Octotheca species often have small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
